channel.title: Visual Studio Online on Thomas Levesque's .NET Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Visual Studio Online on Thomas Levesque's .NET Blog

item.title: Visual Studio Online + Git integration with Team Explorer
item.description: I recently started using Visual Studio Online for personal projects, and I must say it’s a pretty good platform, although it would be nice to be able to host public projects as well as private ones. The thing I like the most is the integration with Visual Studio Team Explorer to manage work items and builds. However, I noticed a little gotcha when using Git for source control : the remote for VS Online must be named origin, otherwise Team Explorer won’t detect that it’s a VS Online project, and it won’t show the “Builds” and “Work items” pages.
